content:
[Q5] Consider the following trigonometric function:

$\qquad g(x)=2\sin\left(\dfrac{1}{3}x-\dfrac{\pi}{3}\right)+4$

**Graph $g(x)$ in the interactive widget.**

hint: the function has a midline of $y = 4$, a period of $6\pi$, a local maximum at $(2.5\pi, 6)$, and a local minimum at $(-\dfrac\pi 2 , 2)$.
